metadata.name: User Added To Root/Sudoers Group Using Usermod
metadata.comment: Detects usage of the "usermod" binary to add users add users to the root or suoders groups

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/usermod')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('-ag root')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('-ag sudoers'))))

output.summary: Detects usage of the "usermod" binary to add users add users to the root or suoders groups

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate administrator activities References: https://pberba.github.io/security/2021/11/23/linux-threat-hunting-for-persistence-account-creation-manipulation/, https://www.configserverfirewall.com/ubuntu-linux/ubuntu-add-user-to-root-group/
